Sign up for their newsletter here . articles.content: Iâ€™m not a software engineer, but Iâ€™m a relatively technical tinker. In earlier posts, I built apps using Replit, Firebase Studio, and Gemini Canvas. Gemini Canvas is pure magic for spinning up an idea in 30 seconds with zero code, but it doesnâ€™t do well for more complex apps that need a database. Firebase Studio is great if you want a powerful, scalable setup â€” but it can feel a bit unwieldy for a hobbyist like me (Iâ€™ll do a deeper dive on that later). Thatâ€™s where Replit shines. articles.content: Following news that Escape from Tarkov is escaping its perpetual beta, the pioneering extraction shooter is also about to make its debut on Steam. Nikita Buyanov, head of the Battlestate Games studio that developed Escape from Tarkov , confirmed on X that the game's Steam page "will be available soon," only teasing that the full details will come later. Buyanov's confirmation comes less than a day after the developer posted a GIF on X of a man spraying steam from an iron. Earlier this mo
articles.author: Jackson Chen

articles.content: It's a regrettable reality that there is never enough time to cover all the interesting scientific stories we come across each month. In the past, we've featured year-end roundups of cool science stories we (almost) missed. This year, we're experimenting with a monthly collection. August's list includes a 3D digital reconstruction of the Shroud of Turin; injecting succulent leaves with phosphors to create plants that glow in different colors; a nifty shape-changing antenna; and snails with a uni

According to a post on X from the movie's official account, the "tournament demands a new time and place, worthy of its spectacle." The delay goes against the trailer and promotional images that Warner Bros. and New Line Cinema already put out, but th

articles.title: Meta is struggling to rein in its AI chatbots
articles.description: Meta is changing some of the rules governing its chatbots two weeks after a Reuters investigation revealed disturbing ways in which they could, potentially, interact with minors. Now the company has told TechCrunch that its chatbots are being trained not to engage in conversations with minors around
articles.content: Meta is changing some of the rules governing its chatbots two weeks after a Reuters investigation revealed disturbing ways in which they could, potentially, interact with minors . Now the company has told TechCrunch that its chatbots are being trained not to engage in conversations with minors around self-harm, suicide, or disordered eating, and to avoid inappropriate romantic banter. These changes are interim measures, however, put in place while the company works on new permanent guidelines. T
articles.author: Terrence Oâ€™Brien

articles.title: The fight against labeling long-term streaming rentals as â€œpurchasesâ€ you â€œbuyâ€
articles.description: New law emboldens complaints against digital content rentals labled as purchases.
articles.content: Words have meaning. Proper word selection is integral to strong communication, whether it's about relaying oneâ€™s feelings to another or explaining the terms of a deal, agreement, or transaction. Language can be confusing, but typically when something is available to "buy," ownership of that good or access to that service is offered in exchange for money. Thatâ€™s not really the case, though, when it comes to digital content. Often, streaming services like Amazon Prime Video offer customers the opt
articles.author: Scharon Harding

articles.content: VPN users are overwhelmed with choice , and there are as many bad options out there as there are good ones. Luckily, NordVPN sits in the latter category, and right now Nord is offering discounted plans across its various tiers. If you take out a two-year NordVPN Plus plan (the company's most popular plan) itâ€™ll cost you $108 for the duration of the contract, with Nord throwing in three extra months at no extra cost. Thatâ€™s 73 percent off the usual rate. As well as Nordâ€™s VPN service, a Plus plan
articles.author: Matt Tate

articles.title: The Vergeâ€™s favorite gifts for book lovers
articles.description: What do you gift somebody who loves books? The obvious answer is "a book," but since true bibliophiles are probably sitting on a stack already, it's worth getting a little more creative. Luckily for you, many of us at The Verge are big bookworms ourselves, which is why we rounded up a bunch of cleve
articles.content: What do you gift somebody who loves books? The obvious answer is "a book," but since true bibliophiles are probably sitting on a stack already, it's worth getting a little more creative. Luckily for you, many of us at The Verge are big bookworms ourselves, which is why we rounded up a bunch of clever, useful gifts our staff can vouch for. Below, you'll find a handful of thoughtful presents fit for any literature-crazed loved one, including personalized book embossers , adjustable bookends , and
articles.author: Sheena Vasani

articles.content: We may not have a date for Stardew Valley 's next major update, but we have confirmation that it's happening. Eric Barone, the developer behind the hit farming sim , announced that there will be a 1.7 update during the Stardew Valley Symphony of Seasons concert in Seattle, later confirming the news with a post on X . Barone, better known as ConcernedApe, didn't reveal a release date, nor any teasers about content. Considering the numbered update, we're expecting more than just a
articles.author: Jackson Chen

articles.title: Earth models can predict the planetâ€™s future but not their own
articles.description: One of the worldâ€™s foremost climate models now faces funding threats.
articles.content: I n the 1960s, meteorologist Edward Lorenz was running weather simulations on an early computer system when he realized that a small rounding difference led to extremely divergent weather predictions. He later called this idea the butterfly effect to communicate that small changes in initial conditions, like a butterfly flapping its wings in Nepal, could produce wildly different outcomes, like rain in New York. But better understanding those initial conditions and how the biological world couple
articles.author: Sarah Scoles, Undark Magazine

Many people have been unable to connect and make or receive calls for hours, while DownDetector’s tracker peaked in the afternoon at around 3:30PM ET with more than 20,000 reports. Some cus
articles.content: Verizon has confirmed to customers in stores and online that its network is having an issue on Saturday. Many people have been unable to connect and make or receive calls for hours, while DownDetector’s tracker peaked in the afternoon at around 3:30PM ET with more than 20,000 reports. Some customers report their service has continued to function throughout the day, so itâ€™s unclear what the cause is exactly. Downdetectorâ€™s outage map showed hotspots in many cities, and Verizon didn’t
